[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/16552935/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/16552935)

Coverage increased (+2.7%) to 27.018% when pulling **5720172393858d847025b68f8c03687188e75370 on refactor/component-id** into **0178acce12c2701933a515d1829d20aa1ed181e2 on master**.

Yes and no. The links are present, but they are expected to be part of the menu system so they are more visible. At present they are not all that easy to find, as the menu item "Links" suggests 3rd party URLs.

If you have a look at some other ASF pages, you will see the difference.

@sebbASF Do you mean, I need to adjust the menu to support sub level? e.g. https://spark.apache.org/ If so, I have to learn how to do that. This website is based on templete, which has not supported that in their demo.
I didn't use Spring session component .  I just create a filter to realize my own wrapper class for request and session .

I try to modify the server.xml of tomcat，adding configuration as flow：
`<Manager className="org.apache.catalina.session.PersistentManager" saveOnRestart="false"/>` , it works and the error doesn't occur .

It does not have to be a sub-level, though that is a common approach.
Many other sites use a side menu.
Do you really use this feature of Tomcat? I am not familiar with this, and didn't intend to effect it.
@ascrutae Look like a bug of Oracle plugin.
yeah. maybe some cases have not been tested.  Could you post me simple demo or the version about oracle driver ?

yeah ,some cases  i found it's hard to write meaningful test case, so right now i just  cover the target code, i can optimize this in the future when I become more familiar with code and design ideas.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/16550976/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/16550976)

Coverage remained the same at 24.365% when pulling **25efb785f2ab32ebc76f1fce622ab00c6a0c84da on candyleer:jacoco_exclude_graphql** into **f62381c4947b3491febdc8c281c06d0833e1c916 on apache:master**.

I won't add the above configuration in Tomcat，because I can't assess the impact on other projects. By adding above configuration,Tomcat will not save session resources when it closes, so the NotSerializableException doesn't occur.

I think maybe some classes are enhanced by SkyWalking, so EnhanceRequireObjectCache was injected into the class skeleton by agent core and spring plugin. Which will cause this issue. 

> because I can't assess the impact on other projects

What do you mean by this? You can't change the config file?

The key of this issue is to find out which classes are added into the Tomcat session. And are they enhanced by SkyWalking agent? such as: some cache client object? But from my understanding, we didn't intend to enhance any classes which may be added in to session. Only exception is only if Spring bean optional plugin is active, which you said you don't. So I guess, this is an error triggered by your application wrong usage of session.
sorry，I have no permissions to modify the company's Tomcat configuration. so Modifying the config file can only work in my local test environment.
I see. Then the only solution is to find out which classes do your applications put into session, and what happens to them. Then we should have the solution.

上海证大爱特金融信息服务有限公司 https://www.laocaibao.com/
正在使用5.0。部分生产已使用，观察一段时间后，全部系统使用。

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/16553897/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/16553897)

Coverage remained the same at 27.018% when pulling **fc70f77f69d8d3375aea68254eb50115ea0f93ea on candyleer:fix_doc_link_and_error** into **bd1286aac47315964e991878a45940e9ad88348f on apache:master**.
Do you set the server addresses right? Please read our document and server address should be `ip:10800` by default.
Why do you set IP as `0.0.0.0`? Please use real net IP, or 127.0.0.1 if you collector is at the same machine with the monitored application.

Agent uses `naming/jetty` for service discovery, and `agent_gRPC/gRPC` for real connection. From your 404, I think you didn't set the address to `naming/jetty`.

Another thing may cause this, because your collector didn't start up right. Please recheck your collector log.

| environment| version|
|:---|:---|
|Agent| 5.0.0-alpha|
|Oracle jdbc driver|11.2.0.4|
|Oracle version| 12c|

 Could you post me a demo to reproduce this issue?
@peng-yongsheng @hanahmily I finished the new codes. But no test yet.
@apache/skywalking-committers Please be advised, this is break feature, after this is merged, query graphQL is not compatible with 5.0.0-alpha UI any more.

I was giving remotehost:8080 in agent conf and now after changing it to remotehost:10800 I am getting connection refused in agent logs. Telneting to port 10800 is not working also.
Nothing found in collector.log or webapp.log-both are empty..
Found some logs in walking-collector-server.log but no error/exception

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/16572144/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/16572144)

Coverage decreased (-0.04%) to 26.977% when pulling **bae4898d40528c3badd5b65dac4b918318f4652d on feature/trace-ui** into **59c945a2b826f27d719860562f10002fcd253b0d on master**.

It is not necessary, but have a story about users.
Most of users deploy elasticsearch and collector in the cloud. But the virtual machine provide 2 address.(e.g. Internet address, VLAN address), but usually, elasticsearch bind to the VLAN address, so we suggest them setting the host to 0.0.0.0.
@nikitap492 Are you still going to send this in two separated PRs? We are waiting for those.
`0.0.0.0` is also used only when you deploy collector in local or the same machine with monitored application. In product env, the real IP address is required.
For elasticsearch, I think it is binding to `localhost` by default, then collector may couldn't connect to it.

The `collector.servers` setting is based on this section in `application.yml`:
```
naming:
  jetty:
    host: localhost
    port: 10800
    contextPath: /
```

Why does your session object have `RestController` annotation? This is the reason. 

Every `@RestController` means a Controller rather than a normal Java value Bean for Spring, and SkyWalking  will instrument these classes for tracing HTTP incoming request. And every instrumented class is added a new field, which value couldn't be serialized, since we didn't expect you serialize a Controller, this violate basic MVC principle.
@peng-yongsheng Comments have been added now.
I change the @RestController annotation in the session object, and it works , thanks a lot for your patience.

Sure. Glad to help. Closing this. 

BTW, if you are putting SkyWalking online, please share to us with your user case, submit a comment included company or project info to here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/issues/443  

Thanks.

@peng-yongsheng What do you thing?
@nikitap492 Thank you for your contribution.

@nikitap492 Please be advised about @peng-yongsheng 's commit: https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/pull/1094/commits/68b9055a48dc5bbac1149d5569a04b7548791094 , which reverses your prev commit. We prefer don't use this style of codes, to make codes easier to read.
@peng-yongsheng Your reverse is not right.

If you are using proxy between agent and collector, you should know, in 5.0.0-alpha, SkyWalking use two address to uplink data. 
1. `naming/jetty` host + port, under HTTP
1. `agent_gRPC/gRPC` host + port, under GRPC

gRPC address returns to agent based on naming query. So this must be a direct address, no proxy. 

In 5.0.0-beta, we provide a new feature: [Direct uplink and disable naming discovery](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/Direct-uplink.md), so you can ignore the (1). But if you are still using proxy, try some proxy supports gRPC.

And you should know, beta is still under developing, I suggest you don't use proxy in this version. 

Or, try use hostname to replace ip in collector yml file, if you know our collector mechanism very well. :)

Supported. @liuhaoyang and @ascrutae you can send your .NET and nodejs components now. 

I proposal to reserve 1000-2000 to .NET, and 2000-3000 to nodejs, but if you are using the same components as Java, e.g. mysql, please consider to add languages under MySQL, rather than add a new one.
